page.title: 15Wallington Fire Station
page.content: The Wallington Fire Station was built in the year 1938. The station has 2 fire engines and 13 men. There are 4 people in each fire engine. The fire engine must have certain equipment like a 1000 foot hose, 300 gallons of water and 10 gallons of foam. 300 gallons of water can hold a fire for 8 minutes. It is guaranteed that if you call a fire station and ask for help, a fire-engine will be there in 3 minutes the next in 5 minutes and the third in 8 minutes. In the whole of London there are 7000 firemen. Each year they recieve 1700 false alarms;the fire engines still attend and will ask British Telecom who telephoned. How- ever each year there are 50,000 fires. In Wallington 435 people were injured and 125 people died during emergencies in 1984. By Holy Trinity School
